resources.description: Access top liquidity pools by TVL across multiple chains (Arbitrum, Base, Ethereum). Tokens do not necessarily need to be token0 and token1 respectively in the pool, they are reordered automatically.

accepts.description: Access top liquidity pools by TVL across multiple chains (Arbitrum, Base, Ethereum). Tokens do not necessarily need to be token0 and token1 respectively in the pool, they are reordered automatically.

resources.description: Access detailed information (including token prices, tvl, volumes, fees and more) about specific liquidity pools across multiple chains (Arbitrum, Base, Ethereum). Exchanges supported on Ethereum include Uniswap V2 / V4, Pancake V2 and Sushiswap V2 / V3. Exchanges supported on Arbitrum include Uniswap V4, Sushiswap V2 / V3 and Camelot V3. Exchanges supported on Base include Uniswap V2 / V3 / V4 and Sushiswap V3.

accepts.description: Access detailed information (including token prices, tvl, volumes, fees and more) about specific liquidity pools across multiple chains (Arbitrum, Base, Ethereum). Exchanges supported on Ethereum include Uniswap V2 / V4, Pancake V2 and Sushiswap V2 / V3. Exchanges supported on Arbitrum include Uniswap V4, Sushiswap V2 / V3 and Camelot V3. Exchanges supported on Base include Uniswap V2 / V3 / V4 and Sushiswap V3.

resources.description: Base X profile mini-endpoint. Fetches a full X profile and the 10 most recent tweets for a given handle, returning the raw profile data plus a trimmed tweet list with key engagement metrics and media. Cost: 0.001 USDC per request.

accepts.description: Base X profile mini-endpoint. Fetches a full X profile and the 10 most recent tweets for a given handle, returning the raw profile data plus a trimmed tweet list with key engagement metrics and media. Cost: 0.001 USDC per request.

handle.description: X handle (username) without the @ prefix, for example WURKDOTFUN or statikheadz.
Normalized X handle that was requested.

price_usdc.description: Fixed price charged for this call in USDC (6 decimals).

profile.description: Full upstream X profile payload for the user, including core fields like id, rest_id, name, screen_name, description, avatar, location and counters.

tweet_count.description: Number of recent tweets returned (up to 10).

tweets.description: Array of up to 10 recent tweets with trimmed but useful metadata: id, text (max 3000 chars; longer texts are truncated), created_at, language, basic user info, engagement metrics, media and links.

extra.name: USD Coin

url.description: The URL from which to extract the content summary.

results.description: Extracted content objects with requestUrl, url (final after redirects), and summary (clean markdown)

includeResponseBody.description: If set to true, includes the full HTML response body as a string in the result.

url.description: The URL from which to extract metadata.

resources.description: Fund your Grove API Account with 1 USDC to tip creators on the internet.

accepts.description: Fund your Grove API Account with 1 USDC to tip creators on the internet.

Authorization.description: Bearer JWT for funding an existing Grove account. When omitted, the call creates and funds a new account instead.

X-PAYMENT.description: Base64-encoded x402 payment payload returned after signing the payment request described in the initial 402 response.

amount.description: Human-readable token amount to fund the tipping account. These funds can be used to tip creators on the internet. Examples: '0.01', '1', '1.05', '100.10'. Defaults to '1' when omitted. Token determined by 'token' parameter (default: USDC).

network.description: Network identifier. Supported: ethereum-mainnet, base-sepolia, base, solana-devnet, solana-testnet, solana-mainnet. Defaults to base when omitted. Account.network is set on first funding (immutable - represents VM type).

referral_code.description: Optional referral code from an existing user (e.g., 'GRV-ABC123'). Only applies to new account creation. If provided for existing accounts, it is ignored. Invalid codes don't block account creation but are reported in referral_status.

token.description: Token symbol. Defaults to USDC when omitted. Supported tokens vary by network. Check network token configuration.

ReferralStatus.description:
Status of referral code application during account creation.

Included in FundResponse to provide feedback on referral code processing.
Allows successful account creation even with invalid referral codes,
while still informing the user of the outcome.
ReferralStatus.title: ReferralStatus

output.description:
Response model for successful funding.

When creating a new account (no JWT provided):
- account_id, api_key, address, and client_address are populated
- Use api_key as Bearer token for future requests
- referral_code contains the new account's shareable referral code
- referral_status contains feedback on any provided referral code

When funding existing account (JWT provided):
- account_id and api_key are None
- address and client_address are populated
- referral_code and referral_status are None (referrals only apply to new accounts)
output.title: FundResponse

resources.name: CDP Facilitator
resources.description: Best-in-class x402 facilitator. Fee-free USDC settlement on Base Mainnet. KYT/OFAC checks on every transaction.

resources.name: Corbits
resources.description: A production grade facilitator which supports multi-network, multi-token, multi-payment schemes.

resources.name: Mogami facilitator
resources.description: A free, developer-focused, production-ready facilitator for x402 payments. Use it instantly online, or launch your own Docker image in seconds.

resources.name: OpenX402.ai Facilitator
resources.description: The first permissionless, gasless and omnichain x402 facilitator that any x402 server can use without login

resources.name: PayAI Facilitator
resources.description: Accept x402 payments on all networks including Avalanche, Base, Polygon, Sei, Solana, and more! Get started in less than 1 minute. Supports all tokens. No API Keys required.

resources.name: Treasure Facilitator
resources.description: Treasure x402 Facilitator available on Base and Base Sepolia. Supports EIP-3009 compliant tokens including USDC, MAGIC, SMOL, MIO, AI Frens tokens, and more.

resources.name: WorldFun Facilitator
resources.description: AWE World.funs x402 Facilitator enables fee-free EIP-3009 payments in USDC and other ERC-20 tokens, handling verification and settlement on Base so developers dont need blockchain infrastructure.

resources.name: x402.org Facilitator
resources.description: Default testnet facilitator for x402

resources.name: x402.rs Facilitator
resources.description: Independent, open-source facilitator in Rust. Easy to self-host, extend to new networks, or use via our hosted instance.
